additionalLabels.description: Additional set of labels to add to all the GCP resources

clusterAnnotations.description: Annotations to apply to the cluster

clusterIdentity.description: The GCP Service Account credentials secret reference, auto-populated

name.description: The GCP Service Account credentials secret name, auto-populated

clusterLabels.description: Labels to apply to the cluster

pods.description: The network ranges from which Pod networks are allocated

services.description: The network ranges from which service VIPs are allocated

controlPlaneVersion.description: The control plane version of the GKE cluster. If not specified, the default version currently supported by GKE will be used

enableAutopilot.description: Indicates whether to enable autopilot for this GKE cluster

gkeClusterName.description: The name of the GKE cluster. If you don't specify a gkeClusterName then a default name will be created based on the namespace and name of the managed control plane

location.description: The location where the GKE cluster will be created. If unspecified, a region will be used, making the cluster regional. Otherwise, specifying a location will create a zonal cluster

additionalLabels.description: AdditionalLabels is an optional set of tags to add to GCP resources managed by the GCP provider, in addition to the ones added by default

diskSizeGB.description: The size of the disk attached to each node, specified in GB. The smallest allowed disk size is 10GB. If unspecified, the default disk size is 100GB

diskType.description: The type of the disk attached to each node

imageType.description: The image type to use for this nodepool

instanceType.description: The name of Compute Engine machine type

kubernetesLabels.description: The labels to apply to the nodes of the node pool

kubernetesTaints.description: The taints to apply to the nodes of the node pool

localSsdCount.description: LocalSsdCount is the number of local SSD disks to be attached to the node

machineType.description: the name of a Google Compute Engine [machine type](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/machine-types). If unspecified, the default machine type is `e2-medium`

autoRepair.description: AutoRepair specifies whether the node auto-repair is enabled for the node pool. If enabled, the nodes in this node pool will be monitored and, if they fail health checks too many times, an automatic repair action will be triggered

autoUpgrade.description: AutoUpgrade specifies whether node auto-upgrade is enabled for the node pool. If enabled, node auto-upgrade helps keep the nodes in your node pool up to date with the latest release version of Kubernetes

maxPodsPerNode.description: The constraint enforced on the max num of pods per node

nodeLocations.description: The list of zones in which the NodePool's nodes should be located

nodePoolName.description: The name of the GKE node pool corresponding to this MachinePool. If you don't specify a name then a default name will be created based on the namespace and name of the managed machine pool

scaling.description: Scaling specifies scaling for the node pool

enableAutoscaling.description: Is autoscaling enabled for this node pool. If unspecified, the default value is true

locationPolicy.description: Location policy used when scaling up a nodepool

maxCount.description: The maximum number of nodes in the node pool

minCount.description: The minimum number of nodes in the node pool

masterAuthorizedNetworksConfig.description: Represents configuration options for master authorized networks feature of the GKE cluster. This feature is disabled if this field is not specified

name.description: The name of an existing GCP network or a new network that will be created by Cluster API Provider GCP

project.description: The name of the project to deploy the cluster to

region.description: The GCP Region the cluster lives in

releaseChannel.description: The release channel of the GKE cluster

version.description: Version represents the version of the GKE control plane

workersNumber.description: The number of the worker nodes. Should be divisible by the number of zones in machines.nodeLocations. If nodeLocations is not specified, must be divisible by the number of zones in this region (default: 3)
